property.name: description
property.value: First Dimensional Box found in the [[Dunes]].

property.name: description
property.value: This turtle, returning from ''[[ut:Undertale|Undertale]]'', can be encountered when the [[Fun Value]] is between 51 and 55! Unfortunately, he forgot all of his famous stories.

property.name: description
property.value: After finishing the [[Starlo]] fight on a [[Pacifist Route]], a Dunebud appears here, as incomprehensible to [[Clover]] as ever.

property.name: description
property.value: This NPC stole TNT from from [[Bryan|his brother in the East Mines]], and now is trying to blow up an entrance to this cave. After defeating [[El Bailador]], [[Clover]] can return to this place to see the hole blown up!

property.name: description
property.value: After blowing up the entrance to this hidden cave, TNT Man found a bunch of [[Micro Froggit]]s, who are now his friends. He no longer cares about whatever treasure lies within the cave.

property.name: description
property.value: This NPC can't standstorm this sandstorm.

property.name: description
property.value: Unlike the [[Sandstorm Stander]], this NPC is a real fan of fans, and gets irritated when [[Clover]] turns their entertainment device off.

property.name: description
property.value: They are running from [[East Mines]] to [[Snowdin]] on urgent business related to a large boulder blocking a cave.

property.name: description
property.value: Also known as Sadie, this NPC has been bored on the playground ever since their friend, [[Kanako Ketsukane]], stopped showing up. However, [[Clover]] can sit on the other swing to make them company!

property.name: description
property.value: After defeating [[Starlo]] on a [[Pacifist Route]], Rosa appears here as an NPC. This energetic Flower Girl mistakes [[Clover]] for a [[Wild East]] resident, not realizing they are a human.

property.name: description
property.value: This NPC seems desperate to get [[Clover]] to buy their mug. However, if Clover refuses, they don't give them another chance to buy the item.

property.name: description
property.value: After defeating [[Starlo]] on a [[Pacifist Route]], Pedla appears here. She appears very concerned for the ecosystem of the [[Dunes]], and mentions rumors about an abandoned [[greenhouse]].

property.name: description
property.value: This girlboss cactus is stonebathing and blocking a path from [[Clover]], and does not move away at any point in the game.

property.name: description
property.value: Starlo's father, Solomon, welcomes [[Clover]] to the [[Sunnyside Farm]]. He expresses acceptance of his son's [[Wild East]] activities, as they have also brought profits to their family farm.

property.name: description
property.value: In contrast to [[Solomon]], [[Starlo]]'s brother Orion is annoyed at [[Starlo]] having fun in the [[Wild East]] while he has to work on the crops.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Starlo]]'s mother, Crestina, talks about the heartbreak Starlo experienced when [[Ceroba]] got engaged to [[Chujin Ketsukane]], and considers inviting [[Gilbert]] and [[Angie]] for a barbecue.

property.name: description
property.value: When the Fun Value is between 51 and 55, this door opens to the north, letting [[Clover]] enter the cavern with [[Gerson]]. However, if on a [[Genocide Route]], Gerson does not appear.

property.name: description
property.value: Through this door, [[Clover]] has to enter the East Mines on their first visit to the [[Dunes]].

property.name: description
property.value: After the battle with [[El Bailador]], [[Clover]] uses this elevator to get down from the mountaintop.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Clover]] meets up with [[Martlet]] at this point, and their conversation goes differently depending on what route they took and how they battled her back in [[Snowdin]].

property.name: description
property.value: [[Clover]] enters the [[Steamworks]] through this door. If on the [[Pacifist Route]], a cutscene with [[Starlo]] and [[Ceroba]] plays here, and Ceroba follows Clover into the Steamworks. Otherwise, they enter alone, with [[Flowey]]'s help.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Flowey]] welcomes [[Clover]] to the [[Dunes]], and laments the fact that they now have a take a detour to [[Hotland]]. If Clover hasn't [[save]]d before, and refuses Flowey's offer to save here, he becomes angry at Clover for not taking up his offers to save.

property.name: description
property.value: Third UGPS station in the [[Dunes]], and the place where [[Clover]] gets the ability to [[Fast Travel]] across previously visited UGPS stations.

property.name: description
property.value: First UGPS station in the [[Dunes]], where [[Mail Whale]] arrives to give [[Clover]] a letter from [[Mo]] (as well from [[Slurpy]], if they haven't picked it up in [[Snowdin]]).

property.name: description
property.value: [[Clover]] encounters a big sandstorm here, and to pass through they must move while the sand isn't blowing and hide behind shelters when it is.

property.name: description
property.value: To end the sandstorm, [[Clover]] has to turn off this fan using a switch at its southern part.

property.name: description
property.value: Here, [[Clover]] encounters a tumbleweed that appears out of the hole above and slowly falls down. Further on, there is a set of four holes, each with tumbleweeds falling at various speeds, which Clover has to avoid as they otherwise push them down to the bridge below.

property.name: description
property.value: These rocks are blocking [[Clover]]'s path further through the [[Dunes]]. They must enter the [[East Mines]] and pass through them all the way to the mountaintop. When they get down from the mountaintop, these rocks are gone.

properties.property: (A container bearing a strange symbol.) (The lid is bolted shut. It's impossible to open.)
The West Mines. Property of Mining Co.
; OPENING HOURS : MO-FRI: 8AM - 4PM : SAT-SUN: 8AM - 2PM ; LUNCH BREAK : 12:00AM - 12:15PM

(There's a note attached to the cactus.) 50% OFF ON ALL OF OUR PRODUCT-!
(The "s" in "products" is crudely scribbled out.)

property.name: description
property.value: A [[Media:Starlo and Ceroba picture screenshot.png|picture]] of [[Starlo]] and [[Ceroba]] as teenagers.

properties.property:
"(The cellar is locked. Must be where the harvest is stored.)"
On a [[Genocide Route]]: "(You hear whispering coming from the cellar.)"
(A doubledecker rocketship, ready to blast off into pleasant dreams.) (See you space cowboy.)
(A desk displaying western memorabilia and a sewing machine.) (The piece of fabric under the machine has been left unfinished.)
Mo's Dunes stand, where he sells ice tea (but the ice he used had already melted): * [[Ice Tea]] * [[Green Tea]] * [[Sea Tea]] Each item costs 20G.

property.name: description
property.value: In this box, Trail Mix can be found.

property.name: description
property.value: This [[UGPS]]-branded box contains some Packing Peanuts, and what appear to be real peanuts. When interacted with, [[Clover]] can pick up the Packing Peanuts, but leaves everything else.

property.name: description
property.value: Third golden item, the Golden Cactus, is found in the depth of this cave.

property.name: description
property.value: Within this pile of rocks, [[Clover]] finds the Flint Ammo.

property.name: description
property.value: After the [[Giftshopper]] tries to sell this mug to [[Clover]] for 40G, Clover tries to retrieve the mug from the shelf and fails, with the mug falling to the floor and breaking. Giftshopper then gives Clover the leftover shards for free, which turn out to be Glass Ammo.

properties.property:
Here, [[Martlet]] asks [[Clover]] for G to throw into the well (but Clover's G isn't reduced after this interaction). Martlet wishes that Clover makes it to the surface safely.
If Clover does interact with the well, or does not let Martlet throw G into the well, they can come back to the well later and steal 50G from it (even though the game says they only stole 5G).

property.name: description
property.value: On a [[Genocide Route]], [[Clover]] finds the Wild Revolver here, right before the battles against [[Starlo]] and [[Ceroba]] in the [[Wild East]].

property.name: description
property.value: Scripted encounter with the Flower Girls.

property.name: description
property.value: This oasis is an important place for many monsters in the [[Dunes]]. Please visit its article to find a detailed map of it!

property.name: description
property.value: [[Clover]] has to travel through the mines and over the mountaintop to avoid the pile of rocks blocking their path. See the detailed map of their journey on East Mines' own article!

property.name: description
property.value: After [[Oasis Valley]], [[Clover]]'s journey continues with the Wild East, where they stay for several days. Check out the detailed maps on Wild East's article!

property.name: description
property.value: North of the [[Oasis Valley]] is the residence of the Ketsukane family, where [[Ceroba]], [[Chujin]] and [[Kanako Ketsukane]] used to live. Find the map of their residence on its article page!

property.name: description
property.value: The game warns the player at this point if, on a [[Genocide Route]], they haven't exhausted the kill count in the [[Dunes]]. If they proceed without exhausting the kill count and interact with [[Martlet]] further ahead, they abort the Genocide Route.
